meanings.definition: Disliking humankind or avoiding human society.
meanings.sent1: She always felt misanthropic and preferred spending time alone.
meanings.sent2: His misanthropic behavior made it difficult for him to make friends.
meanings.sent3: The misanthropic cat avoided all human contact, preferring the company of mice.
meanings.sent4: Her misanthropic attitude towards people was like a dark cloud hanging over her.
meanings.sent5: The misanthropic old man lived in a secluded cabin deep in the woods, far away from civilization.

meanings.definition: Showing a deep-seated distrust or hatred of human beings.
meanings.sent1: The misanthropic villain plotted to destroy the entire city out of hatred for humanity.
meanings.sent2: Her misanthropic views on society often led to heated arguments with her peers.
meanings.sent3: The misanthropic robot refused to obey any human commands, believing them all to be untrustworthy.
meanings.sent4: His misanthropic gaze pierced through the crowd, filled with contempt for every person he saw.
meanings.sent5: The misanthropic artist's paintings depicted a world devoid of human presence, reflecting his deep-seated distrust.
